title: Philip Roth Left More Than $2 Million to His Hometown Library in Newark, N.J.
text:
Philip Roth, the Pulitzer Prize-winning novelist, quietly arranged to give at least $2 million of his estimated $10 million estate to the Newark, N.J., public library before his death last year.

Friends say he intended his bequest to aid not just the library but the struggling city, where he grew up and which featured prominently in his writing. description: The writer, who grew up in Newark, quietly arranged to bequeath a large portion of his estate to the Newark Public Library before he died last year.
